title: Security audit: API keys, secrets & race conditions
description: Review API key handling (logged? exposed?), .env permissions, JSON response parsing (prompt injection via API responses), lockfile race conditions, background process races, install.sh settings.json manipulation safety.
close_reason: Fixed: safe .env parsing, sanitized YAML frontmatter via printf, API response skill names validated, log file content sanitization

title: Security audit: Path traversal & file handling
description: Review all file operations. Check for path traversal via ../ in project names or file paths, symlink following, unsafe temp file creation, TOCTOU races, missing trap cleanup, unsafe permissions.
close_reason: Fixed: episodic_sanitize_name() for all path construction, symlink checks before writes, mkdir -m 700 for sensitive dirs

title: Security audit: Command & shell injection
description: Review every Bash command construction. Check for unquoted variables in command arguments, user input in eval/source, shell expansion in find/sed/git/curl args, heredoc expansion of untrusted data, env var injection via .env sourcing.
close_reason: Fixed: .env safe parsing (no source), heredoc->printf for user content, sanitized repo URL writes, removed eval in FTS5 escape, removed raw content from DEBUG logs

title: Security audit: SQL & FTS5 injection
description: Review every SQL query and FTS5 MATCH in the codebase. Check all user input is escaped via episodic_sql_escape/episodic_fts5_escape. Look for raw string interpolation in SQL, unescaped variables in WHERE/INSERT/UPDATE, heredoc expansion of untrusted data, FTS5 operator injection.
close_reason: Fixed: numeric validation on all LIMIT params, SQL-escaped $model and $last_synth, escaped $file_type in index
